column1: He was launched to the International Space Station aboard Soyuz TMA-11 with the Expedition 16 crew on October 10, 2007.
Sheikh Muszaphar was born in Kuala Lumpur and attended high school at Maktab Rendah Sains, MARA in Muar.
He is the son of homeroom Ustaz Muhaidin.
He then earned a Bachelor of Medicine and Surgery degree from Kasturba Medical College, Manipal, India.
Sheikh Muszaphar is a medical officer, and a university medical officer in medicine at the Universiti Kebangsaan Malaysia.
Sheikh Muszaphar is also a part-time model.
Sheikh Muszaphar and three other finalists were selected at the beginning of 2006 for the Malaysian Angkasawan spaceflight program.
Following the final medical tests and training examinations, on September 17, it was announced that Sheikh Muszaphar would be flying on the Soyuz TMA-11 mission.
Speaking to Malaysian media outlets, Alexander Karchava, the Russian ambassador to Malaysia, stated that Sheikh Muszaphar is a "fully-fledged cosmonaut".
Gibson also said he regarded Sheikh Muszaphar as a peer.
Soyuz TMA-11 carrying Whitson, Malenchenko, and Sheikh Muszaphar, successfully launched at 13:22 UTC, Wednesday, October 10, 2007.
After 11 days in space, Sheikh Muszaphar boarded Soyuz TMA-10 for his return.
TMA-10 undocked from the ISS at 07:14 UTC on October 21, and deorbit occurred at 09:47.

column2: The trajectory was reported by the crew as soon as they came out of the communications blackout caused by plasma surrounding the spacecraft.
A ballistic trajectory is a backup re-entry mode that takes over if something fails during normal re-entry.

column1: The orbit of the ISS results in one day/night cycle every 90 minutes, so the issues of fasting during Ramadan are also addressed.
The guidebook will be translated into Russian, Arabic, and English.
